name: New York City
description: The 'Big Apple' and a historic epicenter for professional wrestling. From the bright lights of Times Square to the grit of the boroughs, it's the ultimate stage.

name: Mexico City Megaplex
description: The Lucha Libre capital of the 21st through 23rd centuries. Where Rey Jaguar unified the world titles in 2034 AD.

name: London
description: A hub for the European wrestling scene, known for its rowdy, singing crowds and a mix of technical and hard-hitting styles.

name: Chicago
description: The 'Windy City', home to some of the most passionate and vocal wrestling fans in the world. A true blue-collar wrestling town.

name: Pittsburgh Citadel
description: The 23rd-century evolution of the Steel City. Hails the legacy of Kurt Angle. Known for its industrial strength and 'Wrestling Machine' academy.

name: Winnipeg Cryo-Hub
description: A high-tech Canadian city in the 22nd and 23rd centuries. Home to the Felix wrestling dynasty and the Alpha Pack.

name: Calgary Spire
description: The legendary home of the Hart family and the 'Loose Cannon' Brian Pillman. A center for technical brilliance and unpredictable energy.

name: Toronto
description: A major Canadian hub for wrestling, hosting massive international spectacles and fostering a rich independent scene.

name: New Orleans
description: The 'Big Easy', known for its unique culture and for hosting some of the most memorable championship moments in history.

name: Osaka Cyber-District
description: The futuristic birthplace of Oda Tsuguri (born 2361 AD). A neon-drenched district where the Oda clan still holds sway.

name: Neo-Tokyo
description: A sprawling cyberpunk metropolis in the 23rd century, rebuilt after the Great Collapse. A hub for tech and underground fighting.

name: Zambezi Sanctuary
description: A lush, technologically advanced kingdom along the Zambezi River, restored to its 10th-century glory by time-displaced technology.

name: Uruk Eternal
description: The ancient city of Mesopotamia, reconstructed in the 23rd century as a living museum and battleground for the Redeemed King, Gilgamesh.

name: Siberian Outpost
description: A harsh, sub-zero prison and training ground in Russia. The birthplace of OMZ's 'Knockout Artist' persona.

name: Ugandan Wilds
description: A protected ecological zone in the 23rd century, echoing the homeland of the Ugandan Giant, Kamala.

name: Slamtown
description: The fictional, yet very real, sovereign state governed by Johnny All Time. A place where gravity is optional.

name: Neo-London Spire
description: A towering vertical city in the UK, preserving the grit and glory of British wrestling tradition.

name: Neo-Paris Sky-Garden
description: A floating garden city above the ruins of old Paris, celebrating art, beauty, and the legacy of Andre the Giant.

name: Lunar Colony Alpha
description: Humanity's first permanent settlement on the Moon, a hub for zero-gravity sports and corporate intrigue.

name: Amazonian Canopy-City
description: A breathtaking vertical city built within the giant trees of the restored Amazon rainforest. A marvel of ecological engineering.

name: Atlantis Reborn
description: A fully submerged city beneath the Atlantic, a marvel of bio-engineering and marine architecture.

name: Perth
description: A vibrant coastal city in Western Australia, known for its passionate sports fans and stunning modern architecture.

name: Melbourne
description: The sporting capital of Australia, with a rich history of hosting massive international spectacles and a very vocal wrestling community.

name: San Juan
description: The historic and vibrant capital of Puerto Rico, a legendary territory where wrestling is part of the cultural fabric.

name: Riyadh
description: The booming capital of Saudi Arabia, a new global hub for massive international wrestling events and high-production spectacles.

name: Jeddah
description: A historic port city on the Red Sea, now home to some of the world's most unique and technologically advanced sporting venues.

name: Dallas
description: The home of 'everything's bigger in Texas,' hosting some of the largest wrestling spectacles in North America.

name: Las Vegas
description: The 'Entertainment Capital of the World,' where every wrestling event feels like a high-stakes gamble.

name: Detroit
description: The 'Motor City,' a gritty, blue-collar town with a passionate wrestling fanbase known for its intensity.

name: Los Angeles
description: The 'City of Angels,' a hub for entertainment and a diverse wrestling scene, from Lucha Libre to Hollywood glamor.

name: Houston
description: A major Texas city with a strong wrestling tradition and a history of hosting mega-events.

name: Orlando
description: The 'Theme Park Capital of the World,' home to many wrestling promotions and a family-friendly atmosphere.

name: Tampa
description: A vibrant Florida city with a growing wrestling scene and a history of hosting major events.

name: East Rutherford
description: Home to MetLife Stadium, a colossal venue just outside New York City, built for the biggest spectacles.

name: Miami
description: A vibrant, multicultural city in Florida, hosting high-energy events with a unique, festive atmosphere.

name: Santa Clara
description: Located in Silicon Valley, this California city hosts major tech events and massive sporting spectacles.

name: Nashville
description: The 'Music City,' a cultural hub in Tennessee with a passionate fanbase and a rich history.

name: Delhi
description: The bustling capital of India, a growing market for professional wrestling with a massive potential audience.

name: SÃ£o Paulo
description: The largest city in Brazil, a vibrant metropolis with a passionate sports culture and a burgeoning wrestling scene.

name: Boston
description: A historic city in Massachusetts with a dedicated sports fanbase and a strong wrestling tradition.

name: Philadelphia
description: The 'City of Brotherly Love,' a legendary hub for hardcore and independent wrestling with a fiercely loyal fanbase.

name: Montreal
description: A vibrant, bilingual city in Quebec, Canada, known for its passionate sports fans and a rich wrestling history.

name: Edmonton
description: A major city in Alberta, Canada, with a growing sports scene and a strong base of wrestling enthusiasts.

name: Manchester
description: A major city in Northern England with a rich industrial history and a strong, vocal wrestling fanbase.

name: Glasgow
description: A passionate Scottish city known for its rowdy crowds and a thriving independent wrestling scene.

name: Osaka
description: Japan's secondary wrestling capital, known for its intense crowds and being the home of many hard-hitting 'Strong Style' battles.

name: Fukuoka
description: A major city on Kyushu Island, Japan, with a rich cultural heritage and a growing appreciation for professional wrestling.

name: Monterrey
description: A modern metropolis in Mexico, known for its industrial strength and a vibrant Lucha Libre scene.

name: Guadalajara
description: A historic city in Mexico, the birthplace of mariachi and tequila, with a deep-rooted Lucha Libre tradition.

name: Berlin
description: The capital of Germany, a city with a dynamic cultural scene and a growing European wrestling presence.

name: Hamburg
description: A major port city in Germany, known for its vibrant nightlife and a passionate, diverse audience for wrestling.

name: Amsterdam
description: The capital of the Netherlands, a cosmopolitan city with a rising interest in professional wrestling.

name: Rotterdam
description: A major port city in the Netherlands, known for its modern architecture and a passionate sports culture.

name: Belfast
description: The capital of Northern Ireland, a city with a strong sense of identity and a passionate, vocal wrestling fanbase.

name: Birmingham
description: A major city in the West Midlands, UK, with a diverse population and a growing appetite for wrestling events.

name: Newcastle
description: A vibrant city in Northeast England, known for its lively atmosphere and dedicated sports and entertainment fans.

name: Liverpool
description: A historic port city in Northwest England, famous for its music, culture, and enthusiastic sports supporters.

name: Dublin
description: The capital of Ireland, a city with a rich cultural heritage and a rapidly expanding wrestling scene.

name: Post-Apocalyptic Badlands
description: A desolate, lawless region where only the toughest survive, and wrestling is a brutal fight for survival.

name: Floating City of Shangri-La
description: A mythical city floating high above the clouds, where martial arts and wrestling are elevated to an art form.
